result.execSummary:
The defendant Minagua Seattle Michaeleon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Must report to Probation by 4:00 pm on June 16, 2015.  
May petition for early discharge at 6 months if probation feels appropriate.  
2 days sentence credit if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Must provide DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00.
No contact with:  St. Croix Tavern, Ward's Bar, Logger's Bar & Grill.

Compas evaluation and follow through with recommendations.
Alcohol is permitted as necessary for completion of job and as deemed appropriate by Probation.

records.addlTxt:
CASES: 15CM58, 15CM194 & 15CM195. Defendant Minagua Seattle Michaeleon in court with attorney Shelly Tomtschik.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 1:30 pm.  Br 1 cases.  15CM195-DRI.
15CM58-DPA entered into on 3/9/15.  CT-Count 1-Repeater stricken.  Count 1-D/C w/o repeater-guilty plea.  CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered.
15CM194-Count 1-Repeater stricken.  Count 1-D/C w/o repeater-guilty plea.  CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered.  All other counts/cases DRI.  
SENTENCE:  Order DNA sample/surcharge-15CM194.  
On Both-W/H sentence, 1 yr probation.  COMPAS & follow thru.  Alcohol as long as necessary for completion of job and as deemed appropriate by probation.  2 days sentence credit if revoked.  NC-St Croix Tavern, Ward's Bar, Logger's Bar & Grill.  Must report to probation by 4 pm on 6/16.  PCR.  May petition for early discharge at 6 mo if probation feels appropriate.  2:25 pm adj.
Report in support of probable cause for arrest. Request for criminal complaint

Not to have contact with: St Croix Falls Walmart, St Croix Tavern and Holiday Gas Station.  Not to possess or consume alcohol.  Absolute Sobriety.  DE may request expungement of the DNA Sample under WI Stat 165.77(4) by Petitioning the WI DOJ.
